greetingsDialog.content: The step-by-step wizard will help familiarize you with your account settings so that you can begin setting up your business phone system. Your essential account information has been entered during registration.
greetingsDialog.title: Welcome to the platform

steps.1: Access your Account Settings by clicking on your name.
steps.2: Your Admin User settings can be viewed in the User tab. Individual settings such as Timezone, Language and Date & Time can be changed based on your preferences. Additional you can integration your conatcts to sync this e.g. with your mobile, to have phonenumbers with your in realtime.
steps.3: Your Admin Account settings can be viewed in the Account tab. Here you can add a Technical Contact if you wish, and set Timezone & Language for the entire account. The accountname and realm should not reseted, because your device need this domains to connect with it  The account fraudsecurity protects you from password theft, and the cost overrun only to limit. We recommend to put on the maximum daily costs (eg 20.00 per day. ) After saving only your resellers can unlock this again.
steps.4: The invoicing is done via e-mail from us automatically. But you can adjust the delivery by mailing to your habits manually. Please note that the credit card that you used during registration is currently on file in this tab.
steps.5: Chargeable calls are here listed. When making chargeable calls will be made "per minute". Not cost endorse calls are not listed.
steps.6: Here you can view your current subscriptions. Details of the respective subscriptions are listed on our website, and explains details. For further questions please contact us.
steps.7: Here is view all transactions made under your account, including all one-time fees and charges

endDialog.content: Now that you're familiarized with the different settings, you can take a few moments to change or update any of the information to fit your needs. When you're ready to begin setting up your phone system, close out of these settings by clicking the close button in the upper right or by simply clicking on your name again.
endDialog.title: Done!

user.title: User
user.passwordsNotMatching: The passwords you typed don't match
user.__comment: UI-1335: Adding hours settings to the user settings
user.quickcalldeviceHelp: The quickcall device is for set default phone to dialout per mouseclick in the userportal.
user.contactsyncURLHelp: Here you can set your URL of Activsync accounts.
user.contactsyncPasswordHelp: Here you set your passwort of Activsync accounts.
user.contactsyncUserHelp: Here your can set your user of Activsync account, to sync all contact data between phones.

fraud.title: Fraud Accountsecurity
fraud.helptip: We are suggest to set to 10.00 per day. Even if you password was stolen, your account is overflow protected.

provision.title: Automatic Devicesettings
provision.urlPassHelp: URL-Password is for use phones with a setting url, to protect your userdata for provision.
provision.provisionDomainHelp: With domainrestricktion is possible allow only defined ip-ddress to lookup the provisioning data.
provision.provisionPassHelp: The Phone admin password is to login to the local prosioning ip-phone.
provision.zoiperTokenHelp: The Zoiper Token, is as hash for zoiper provisioning to use. Go to get to http://oem.zoiper.com and login as new provider
provision.supportProvisionHelp: If you want use autoprovision, you have to enable this.
provision.supportCreatenewHelp: There you can allow to add and edit devices for the userportal.
provision.firmwareupdateHelp: If you want enable automatic firmware update, you can set on or off here.
provision.keytemplateHelp: You can define one phone template, to use (audio, video, restrictions, keysettings) this as template for new phone adding.

dialplan.title: Accout-Dialplan
dialplan.descriptHelp: Here you can define your local dialing rules

emergencyplan.descriptHelp: Here you define your emergencyplan for call your police and hopitaly.

account.title: Account
account.technicalConnectHelp: Enter your Connectnumber of your provider for your Internet here.
account.technicalLineHelp: Enter your house Line-No for Internetconnect in.
account.__comment: UI-966: Added common control to select carrier in myaccount

billing.title: Credit Card
billing.missingCard: Your credit card information is invalid, expired or missing - please update your credit card and save the changes.
billing.name: Billing Name

trunks.title: Trunks
trunks.helpTwoway: The number of Two-way trunks defines how many concurrent calls your platform can handle at one time.
trunks.helpInbound: The number of Inbound trunks defines how many simultaneous calls you can receive to your phone system.
trunks.__comment: UI-664: Adding the real twoway sliders
trunks.helpOutbound: The number of Outbound trunks defines how many concurrent external calls you can place at one time.
trunks.exampleTwoway: EXAMPLE: 10 Two-way Trunks would allow your system to handle 6 inbound calls and 4 outbound calls at the same time.
trunks.exampleInbound: EXAMPLE: 5 Inbound Trunks allow your platform to handle 5 simultaneous incoming calls
trunks.exampleOutbound: EXAMPLE: 10 Outbound Trunks allow your platform to handle 10 simultaneous calls to external numbers

balance.title: Per Minute
balance.payPerMinute: Pay-per-minute allows you to pay only for what you use. Deposit money into your account to get started, then pay-as-you-go for usage.
balance.invalidAmount: There is an error with the amount you typed! Please make sure to type a number using only digits '.' or ','
balance.autoRechargeEnabled: The Automatic Recharge of credits is now enabled!
balance.autoRechargeCancelled: You successfully cancelled the Automatic Recharge of your credits.
balance.creditsAdded: You successfully added {{amount}} to your balance!
balance.__comment: UI-1324: Adding the option to disable Braintree through a config flag
balance.disabledAddCreditTooltip: Braintree is required to perform this action. Please contact your administrator for more information.
balance.__comment: UI-1810: Implement new mock-up for 'Add Credits' popup with the ability to set Threshold Alerts

missingValue.title: Something seems to be missing!
missingValue.threshold_alerts_content: You've turned on Threshold Alerts, but it looks like you forgot to define the threshold amount. This is required in order for Threshold Alerts to take effect. Please either set a threshold amount, or turn off Threshold Alerts.
missingValue.auto_recharge_content: You've turned on Auto Recharge, but it looks like you forgot to define the Low balance threshold and/or Recharge Amount. These are both required in order for Auto Recharge to work. Please set the Threshold and/or Recharge Amount or turn Auto Recharge off.

manageCredits.text: Adding Credits Manually allows you to immediately increase your Current Balance. Maintaining a Current Balance is very important, as it is necessary for international or per-minute calls, e911, caller ID, and other system features that incur a charge.

thresholdAlerts.text: Threshold Alerts help you prevent shut off of services to your account by notifying you when your Current Balance gets low. It is strongly recommended to have Threshold Alerts turned on for your account.

labels.notifyMe: Notify me when balance falls bellow this amount

autoRecharge.text: Auto Recharge enables you to set up a threshold to automatically add credit, and determines how much will be refilled each time. Auto Recharge also will notify you via email when an account is recharged.

labels.balanceFalls: When balance falls below this amount
labels.rechargeAccount: Recharge this account with this amount

help.secondPart: Auto Recharge will only run once per day.
help.thirdPart: If the low balance threshold hits for the second time in one day and Auto Recharge has already occurred, you will receive an email notifying you that your account has reached the low balance threshold, however, the Account Admin must add more credit manually.

servicePlan.empty: Your current service plan is empty!
